label: 545.  Allard Belin Barnwell to Catherine Osborn Barnwell -- n.d.
description: Partial letter from Allard Barnwell, Rome, GA, to mother, Catherine Osborn Barnwell, describing his daily routine while building a house himself.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: Allard Barnwell.  Rome Ga Feby 27th  Dearest Mother  I have for several days been wanting to write you a few lines but have been too busy & now I must [Just?] write you a letter.  Your last came & the plaster went immediately on but I continue to suffer & am very stiff & painful which does not suit my [hard?] manual labor.  I am up before day & cut all the wood for fire & stove I then milk my cow feed my big calf feed horse & pig & fowls clean house & am ready for breakfast at 7 1/2.  I then work either on the house which I am building entirely without hireing any one or cutting & clearing up the woods for a garden which is not yet fenced or broken up.  I dine at 1 oc & we live on hog & hominy pretty much & wheat breads.  N it cooks with [Marys?] help & you know good cooking makes things nice we eat in our kitchen, I am [compelled?] to come in here ever day or
